snippet: The move creates a military air patrol region that overlaps with zones declared by Japan and China at a time of heightened tensions over disputed territory in the region.
abstract: South Korea says it is expanding its air patrol zone for first time in 62 years to include airspace over East China Sea that is also claimed by Beijing and Tokyo; move is latest sign of broadening discord among neighboring countries, who are already locked in territorial and historical disputes; airspace disputes were major topic in Vice Pres Joseph R Biden Jr's recent visit to Japan, China and South Korea.
lead_paragraph: The move creates a military air patrol region that overlaps with zones declared by Japan and China at a time of heightened tensions over disputed territory in the region.

headline.main: South Korea Announces Expansion of Its Air Defense Zone
headline.print_headline: After China, South Korea to Expand Its Own Air Defense Zone
